alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Green; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Green, central Taylor, west central Casey and northeastern Adair Counties through 1145 AM EDT/1045 AM CDT/... At 1129 AM EDT/1029 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Campbellsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Taylor, west central Casey, northeastern Adair and east central Green Counties, including the following locations... Christine, Absher, Arista, Coburg, South Campbellsville, Romine, Wrights, Mannsville, Wooleyville and Acton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
